dt: {bc}a disturbance or commotion typically caused by a dispute or conflict

dt.t: In all the {wi}kerfuffle{/wi}, nobody seemed to have noticed Harry, which suited him perfectly.
It's not the only school with dress code issues; almost every week there's a local story about some {wi}kerfuffle{/wi} over what kids wear to school.

et: alteration of {it}carfuffle{/it}, from Scots {it}car-{/it} (probably from Scottish Gaelic {it}cearr{/it} wrong, awkward) + {it}fuffle{/it} to become disheveled
shortdef: a disturbance or commotion typically caused by a dispute or conflict
